alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 9:11PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Ulster, western Dutchess, western Columbia and Greene Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 911 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Preston Hollow to near Marlboro. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, Beacon, New Paltz, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Hunter, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Hurley, Woodstock, Wappingers Falls, Livingston, New Baltimore and Coxsackie. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster
